ghostPost.title: Particl Blockchain will launch Monday, July 17th 2017 at 13:00 UTC
ghostPost.plaintext:
Project Update: July 10th, 2017
The time has come for world domination.
A bit dramatic but going off the passion and excitement for PART tokens to be
distributed, staked, traded and most importantly used we thought it was
appropriate.

> The wait is nearly over, only a few things remain.
Short-term Roadmap
Wallet Creation
Participants in our funding round have 48 hours remaining before we close down
wallet creation. If you haven’t set up your wallet yet we provide guides here: 
https://particl.news/tagged/guide

 * Guide: How to generate your Particl wallet—
   https://particl.news/guide-how-to-generate-your-particl-exchange-passphrase-1fd78ba36fd1

We strongly suggest you follow the 10 minute guide above to create your wallet.
This ensures you receive your PART as soon as possible. Contributors who don’t
will need to wait on the team and go through a manual process. We have a
priority list of people who will need the team’s help regardless:

 * Our overfunders
   [https://particl.news/tokens-holders-and-next-steps-part-1-b9d7cd7e7887] who
   have patiently waited for 3 months with zero PART balances (thank you for
   trusting us!).
 * Contributors who didn’t create wallets before launch — this will be a manual
   process and can take several days to complete. (you have the power to not be
   in this group!)
 * Our approved claimants for the Community Initiative #1
   [https://particl.news/a-community-driven-initiative-e26724100c3a] (be sure to
   thank your fellow PARTicipants for their generosity)

Particl Core Source Code
With the release of PART tokens, the Particl Foundation will also open source
the Particl codebase Monday, July 17th.

Particl Wallet Compiles
Monday, July 17th we’ll be uploading OS compiles for folks to get ready for
launch. Keep an eye on our github page for the release of these official
compiles for your operating system. https://github.com/particl

Particl.io Update
Our website https://particl.io is being redesigned as we speak. The drop-dead
date for it to go live will be Monday, July 17th. If it’s ready this weekend it
will be released this weekend. We are migrating it to Github
[https://github.com/particl/particl.io] so the community developers and
contributors can help make it the best landing page for the Particl Project as
possible. We look forward to your volunteerism!

Particl Mainnet
As stated earlier, this will be Monday, July 17th at 13:00 UTC. The team created
twin wallet designs as a precautionary measure against delays to the public
launch. Being trailblazers with Electron and Angular is definitely exciting and
ambitious but also 10x more complicated. Having something as important as the
GUI be the reason for any delay would be unacceptable.

Particl QT will be an option when mainnet releases next Monday and will be
recommended for the smoothest interface for users to interact with each other on
the Particl network. Advanced users will be curious about the Electron wallet
and that will be available Monday as well; even if we decided to start it on
TESTNET5 to insure the smoothest mainnet launch possible.

This GUI is utilitarian by design to provide a familiar user environment to
invoke all the calls in the daemon. Particl QT is a compact version of our
wallet, offering all the enhancements the team has built without the sexiness.

Particl TESTNET5
The team will also setup our fifth phase of our test network after mainnet on
Monday, July 17th. We reserve the right to shift our Electron GUI to this test
environment for further bug testing if it looks like releasing it will bring
undue stress on the team or users because of possible issues not worked through
properly.

Thank you for your passion for this project! Make sure you’ve created a Particl
wallet if you’re due PART tokens on distribution.

Particl Team
ghostPost.html:
Project Update: July 10th, 2017

The time has come for world domination.

A bit dramatic but going off the passion and excitement for PART tokens to be distributed, staked, traded and most importantly used we thought it was appropriate.

The wait is nearly over, only a few things remain.

Short-term Roadmap

Wallet Creation

Participants in our funding round have 48 hours remaining before we close down wallet creation. If you haven’t set up your wallet yet we provide guides here: https://particl.news/tagged/guide

  • Guide: How to generate your Particl wallet — https://particl.news/guide-how-to-generate-your-particl-exchange-passphrase-1fd78ba36fd1

We strongly suggest you follow the 10 minute guide above to create your wallet. This ensures you receive your PART as soon as possible. Contributors who don’t will need to wait on the team and go through a manual process. We have a priority list of people who will need the team’s help regardless:

  • Our overfunders who have patiently waited for 3 months with zero PART balances (thank you for trusting us!).
  • Contributors who didn’t create wallets before launch — this will be a manual process and can take several days to complete. (you have the power to not be in this group!)
  • Our approved claimants for the Community Initiative #1 (be sure to thank your fellow PARTicipants for their generosity)

Particl Core Source Code

With the release of PART tokens, the Particl Foundation will also open source the Particl codebase Monday, July 17th.

Particl Wallet Compiles

Monday, July 17th we’ll be uploading OS compiles for folks to get ready for launch. Keep an eye on our github page for the release of these official compiles for your operating system. https://github.com/particl

Particl.io Update

Our website https://particl.io is being redesigned as we speak. The drop-dead date for it to go live will be Monday, July 17th. If it’s ready this weekend it will be released this weekend. We are migrating it to Github so the community developers and contributors can help make it the best landing page for the Particl Project as possible. We look forward to your volunteerism!

Particl Mainnet

As stated earlier, this will be Monday, July 17th at 13:00 UTC. The team created twin wallet designs as a precautionary measure against delays to the public launch. Being trailblazers with Electron and Angular is definitely exciting and ambitious but also 10x more complicated. Having something as important as the GUI be the reason for any delay would be unacceptable.

Particl QT will be an option when mainnet releases next Monday and will be recommended for the smoothest interface for users to interact with each other on the Particl network. Advanced users will be curious about the Electron wallet and that will be available Monday as well; even if we decided to start it on TESTNET5 to insure the smoothest mainnet launch possible.

This GUI is utilitarian by design to provide a familiar user environment to invoke all the calls in the daemon. Particl QT is a compact version of our wallet, offering all the enhancements the team has built without the sexiness.

Particl TESTNET5

The team will also setup our fifth phase of our test network after mainnet on Monday, July 17th. We reserve the right to shift our Electron GUI to this test environment for further bug testing if it looks like releasing it will bring undue stress on the team or users because of possible issues not worked through properly.

Thank you for your passion for this project! Make sure you’ve created a Particl wallet if you’re due PART tokens on distribution.

Particl Team

Thank you for your passion for this project! Make sure you’ve created a Particl wallet if you’re due PART tokens on distribution.

prev.plaintext:
Graphical User Interface (GUI) included
As we prepare for Particl Mainnet next week
[https://particl.news/particl-blockchain-will-launch-monday-july-17th-2017-at-13-00-utc-3348e8958657] 
(July 17th) we want to begin battle testing components on our fourth test
network today, specifically the basic graphical user interface (GUI) built on
Qt.

Getting Started Guide
 * Begin here: 
   https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Particl-Testnet-Getting-Started-d9yhExvCaW6vCp3qLUwuW

next.title: Particl Foundation is Approved
next.excerpt: The Swiss Foundation Supervisory Authority has approved the legal structure of the Particl Foundation and its funding structure.
next.custom_excerpt: The Swiss Foundation Supervisory Authority has approved the legal structure of the Particl Foundation and its funding structure.

primary_tag.name: News
primary_tag.description: Keep track of all the news related to Particl and its ecosystem!

tags.name: News
tags.description: Keep track of all the news related to Particl and its ecosystem!

next.plaintext:
The Swiss Foundation Supervisory Authority has approved the legal structure of
the Particl Foundation and its funding structure.
> The foundation and its board will strictly function as an entity with the
mission of providing funding and support for the Particl ecosystem, the
continued development of the Particl network and academic, non-profit &
for-profit development of enhancements for the Particl platform and privacy
domain. The foundation will not govern nor make choices for the network itself,
as the network will be governed in a decentralized manner by the native voting
system directed by the network token holders themselves.
This long-awaited regulatory approval means the team is finalizing preparations
for Mainnet launch, PART distribution and Proof of Stake network
stability/security measures.

Particl Foundation —LinkedIn [https://www.linkedin.com/company-beta/24778523/]
next.html:
The Swiss Foundation Supervisory Authority has approved the legal structure of the Particl Foundation and its funding structure.

The foundation and its board will strictly function as an entity with the mission of providing funding and support for the Particl ecosystem, the continued development of the Particl network and academic, non-profit & for-profit development of enhancements for the Particl platform and privacy domain. The foundation will not govern nor make choices for the network itself, as the network will be governed in a decentralized manner by the native voting system directed by the network token holders themselves.

This long-awaited regulatory approval means the team is finalizing preparations for Mainnet launch, PART distribution and Proof of Stake network stability/security measures.

Particl Foundation — LinkedIn

childHtmlRehype.html:
The Swiss Foundation Supervisory Authority has approved the legal structure of the Particl Foundation and its funding structure.

The foundation and its board will strictly function as an entity with the mission of providing funding and support for the Particl ecosystem, the continued development of the Particl network and academic, non-profit & for-profit development of enhancements for the Particl platform and privacy domain. The foundation will not govern nor make choices for the network itself, as the network will be governed in a decentralized manner by the native voting system directed by the network token holders themselves.

This long-awaited regulatory approval means the team is finalizing preparations for Mainnet launch, PART distribution and Proof of Stake network stability/security measures.

Particl Foundation — LinkedIn

children.value: The Swiss Foundation Supervisory Authority has approved the legal structure of the Particl Foundation and its funding structure.

The foundation and its board will strictly function as an entity with the mission of providing funding and support for the Particl ecosystem, the continued development of the Particl network and academic, non-profit & for-profit development of enhancements for the Particl platform and privacy domain. The foundation will not govern nor make choices for the network itself, as the network will be governed in a decentralized manner by the native voting system directed by the network token holders themselves.
This long-awaited regulatory approval means the team is finalizing preparations for Mainnet launch, PART distribution and Proof of Stake network stability/security measures.
